publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1113 Tommy Sheridan: Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission-That the Parliament believes that the Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission must have unimpeded access to all Crown Office papers and relevant evidence in relation to any case which the Commission is investigating; believes that access to requested papers and associated evidence is essential for the Commission to operate as a genuinely independent and credible investigatory body able to uncover miscarriages of justice, and considers that the Crown Office must release all relevant papers requested by the Criminal Cases Review Commission without condition or impediment.
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Michael Russell*

S1M-1113 Tommy Sheridan: Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission-That the Parliament believes that the Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission must have unimpeded access to all Crown Office papers and relevant evidence in relation to any case which the Commission is investigating; believes that access to requested papers and associated evidence is essential for the Commission to operate as a genuinely independent and credible investigatory body able to uncover miscarriages of justice, and considers that the Crown Office must release all relevant papers requested by the Criminal Cases Review Commission without condition or impediment. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Alex Neil*

S1M-1113 Tommy Sheridan: Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission-That the Parliament believes that the Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission must have unimpeded access to all Crown Office papers and relevant evidence in relation to any case which the Commission is investigating; believes that access to requested papers and associated evidence is essential for the Commission to operate as a genuinely independent and credible investigatory body able to uncover miscarriages of justice, and considers that the Crown Office must release all relevant papers requested by the Criminal Cases Review Commission without condition or impediment. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Christine Grahame*
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Scott Barrie*

S1M-1113 Tommy Sheridan: Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission-That the Parliament believes that the Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission must have unimpeded access to all Crown Office papers and relevant evidence in relation to any case which the Commission is investigating; believes that access to requested papers and associated evidence is essential for the Commission to operate as a genuinely independent and credible investigatory body able to uncover miscarriages of justice, and considers that the Crown Office must release all relevant papers requested by the Criminal Cases Review Commission without condition or impediment. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-1113 Tommy Sheridan: Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission—That the Parliament believes that the Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission must have unimpeded access to all Crown Office papers and relevant evidence in relation to any case which the Commission is investigating; believes that access to requested papers and associated evidence is essential for the Commission to operate as a genuinely independent and credible investigatory body able to uncover miscarriages of justice, and considers that the Crown Office must release all relevant papers requested by the Criminal Cases Review Commission without condition or impediment. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-1113 Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (lodged on 27 July 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Dr Richard Simpson*

S1M-1113 Tommy Sheridan: Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission—That the Parliament believes that the Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission must have unimpeded access to all Crown Office papers and relevant evidence in relation to any case which the Commission is investigating; believes that access to requested papers and associated evidence is essential for the Commission to operate as a genuinely independent and credible investigatory body able to uncover miscarriages of justice, and considers that the Crown Office must release all relevant papers requested by the Criminal Cases Review Commission without condition or impediment. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dr Richard Simpson
